title: Data Engineer
job_description: With our strong investment in research and development and our culture of continuous improvement, Hexcel is the industry leader in the manufacturing of advance composite materials, including carbon fiber, woven reinforcements, resins, prepregs, honeycombs and additive manufactured parts. We invite you to join the Hexcel team at various manufacturing sites, sales offices and R&T centers around the globe. Become a part of the “strength within.”Hexcel is currently seeking a hybrid Data Engineer for our Salt Lake City, UT, USA location. May also be located at Casa Grande, AZ, Decatur, AL, Seguin, TX, Pottsville, PA.The selected individual will be responsible for but not limited to the following obligations:Working with product owners to identify and design data solutions Engineering data pipelines to pull data from on premises and cloud data sourcesCreate & maintain optimized data pipeline architectureExtracting data and consolidating with data lakes, data warehouse and data martsEngineering models to connect different data sources togetherConstructing a library of data components that can easily be reused to answer different business questionsTroubleshooting and fixing production issuesQualifications:Three plus years of relevant ETL, data engineering or similar experience preferred; open to various levels of experienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent, relevant experienExperience with cloud data platforms requiredExperience with Azure SQL Server, Azure Synapse, Azure Analysis Services and Azure Data Factory highly desirable, but not essentialappetite for new technologies and methodologiesStrong understanding of Power BI platform and Power BI paginatedDesign complex data sets to meet the needs of business requirementsTroubleshoot and optimize data pipelinesStrong knowledge of SQL; Understanding of DAX and/or MDX a plusExperience with Databricks desirable, but not essentialThis position is restricted to U.S. citizens due to U.S. federal government contracts that require the employment of only persons who are U.S. citizens. Hexcel (NYSE: HXL) is a global leader in advanced composites technology, a leading producer of carbon fiber, and the world leader in honeycomb manufacturing for the commercial aerospace industry.Hexcel is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, status as protected veteran, or any other protected class.

title: Data Engineer for Lab Data Platform
job_description: Pathos was founded to revolutionize precision medicine in cancer by harnessing the power of machine learning to transform drug development. Pathos aims to accelerate traditional oncology approaches based upon a comprehensive and integrated data-first strategy to discover and develop drugs for precise biological pathways. Pathos is currently pursuing co-development and in-licensing opportunities to build a portfolio of clinical stage oncology assets, applying its technology to find the right patients and indications, resulting in a highly improved probability of success and faster time to market.The founding team built and scaled Tempus Labs, an AI-enabled diagnostics company that has built the world’s largest library of clinical and molecular data and an operating system to make sense of it. Through this experience, the founders have seen how precision medicine can transform lives, yet many patients remain who need better therapies. A new approach is needed to change the paradigm of drug development to rapidly serve these unmet needs, highlighting a unique opportunity for Pathos to pursue. We’re looking for other trailblazers who see the world differently and want to forge this new path with us.Our team is distributed across the US with hubs in New York and Salt Lake. While we still operate with the agility of a startup, we are scaling to advance our platform.This role is responsible for managing our data produced by our lab, pipelines transforming the data, and platform for storing and accessing the data.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign data storage solutions for lab instrument and analysis dataDeploy data pipelines for transforming our data (ETL)Guide Data Scientists and Computational Biologists on best practices for data processingCreate tools for Scientists, Computational Biologists, and Data Scientists to ingest, process, store, and access dataCollaborate on architecting and building our lab data platformWho you areRequiredBachelor’s degree in CS (or equivalent) and 2+ years as a Software EngineerDesire to work on cross-functional teams of Scientists, Computational Biologists, and Data ScientistsFamiliarity with cloud IaaS (GCP, AWS)Knowledge of Relational Databases (PostgreSQL)Familiarity with designing OLTP and OLAP systemsNice to haveFamiliarity with biological data, including sequencing dataBackground in using Kubernetes (GKE)Knowledge of Knowledge Graphs, Ontologies, and Resource Description Framework (RDF)Experience with infrastructure management and devops toolsInterest in applying sound data engineering and data management principles to research at scale.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Platform (Contract)
job_description: Employee Applicant Privacy NoticeWho we are:Shape a brighter financial future with us.Together with our members, we’re changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance.We’re a next-generation financial services company and national bank using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we’re at the forefront. We’re proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people’s lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. In this role you will be contributing to the long-term success of SoFi’s data vision by building out distributed systems and scalable data platforms.As a Senior engineer on the Data Platform team at SoFi, you'll be tasked with building critical components and features. You will implement battle-tested patterns and interfaces, squash bugs, refactor code and continually grow as an engineer. The ideal candidate has a strong software engineering background and problem-solving ability along with cloud computing (AWS) and data engineering skill set with prior experience on technologies such as Snowflake, Airflow, dbt, Kafka, Spark, Dask, Python, and Tableau. Additionally, you will demonstrate SoFi’s core values by honing your skills as an effective communicator, showing personal responsibility, and setting ambitious goals. design scalable data solutions.Write high-quality, efficient, and scalable code to implement new features and functionality on the data platform.Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to other team members to ensure code quality and maintainability.Work with product managers and other stakeholders to understand user requirements and implement solutions that meet their needs.Participate in team meetings and contribute to discussions on technology, design, and implementation.Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in data engineering, and cloud technologies.Develop and optimize data pipelines using dbt and Airflow to ensure efficient data processing and data quality checks.Architect and implement data governance and metadata management solutions to maintain data integrity and compliance.Build a system to identify data quality issues and implement solutions to address them effectively.Utilize your proficiency in Python to develop custom scripts and tools to enhance data operations and automation.Mentor and guide junior team members, providing technical expertise and fostering a culture of continuous learning.What You’ll Need:Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on data engineering and data platform development.Extensive hands-on experience with Snowflake, AWS services, dbt, and Airflow.Strong understanding of data quality best practices and data governance principles.Proven track record in metadata management and data infrastructure design.Proficiency in Python for data manipulation, scripting, and automation.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Strong communication skills to effectively work with diverse stakeholders and present technical concepts.Nice to Have:Interest in personal financeCompensation And BenefitsThe base pay range for this role is listed below. title: Sr. Data Engineer
job_description: Why LVT:LVT (LiveView Technologies) is making the world a safer place, and we need your help! Based in Utah, LVT is the world's leader in physical security platforms and data. With our systems in every state and working with Fortune 500 enterprise companies, we're positioned for vast expansion in the years to come. While we were founded nearly 20 years ago, we stay true to our roots of innovation, which has led to our consistent scaling of a rate of 100% year-over-year in the last 6 years. If you are looking for a market-leading organization with untapped potential, look no further than LVT.We’ve been very intentional about our growth and profitability, which has driven our massive growth trajectory. We need self-motivated, innovative go-getters at every level to keep up with the explosive demand. At LVT, we provide a fulfilling career that allows you to live your best life at work and at home. We provide the culture to work smart and have fun while giving you the flexibility needed for yourself and your loved ones.About the Role:We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to join our Enterprise Data team. The ideal candidate will be technically proficient with a strong emphasis on collaboration, communication, and work ethic. This role involves working closely with business stakeholders to gather and identify data project requirements, as well as implementing solutions to support business analytics through data warehouse development, API data extraction, and data pipeline creation.Key Requirements/Responsibilities:Expertise in SQL for data manipulation and analysis. Experience building data warehouses for business analytics purposes. Proficiency in extracting data from APIs using Python. Demonstrated experience in collaborating with business stakeholders to gather and identify data project requirements. Experience with CI/CD tools and Git for version control. 4-5 years of experience as a data engineer or equivalent. Participate in the development of best practices and tools based on business needs. Ensure data and assets are classified appropriately. Support delivery of information in accordance with Data Governance standards and data management practices. Demonstrate data analytical skills in understanding and correcting data discrepancies, identifying data anomalies, and root cause analysis. Experience implementing end-to-end data management activities, from foundational activities like data governance, data quality, and metadata management, to value-deliverables like data warehousing & BI, data science and analytics, and data-driven applications. Experience with data integration, including ETL methodologies, CDC, batch and continuous processing between source systems and data buses and/or data warehouses. Competent data modeling in both logical and physical data models (OLAP/Dimensional, OLTP/Relational), including understanding and implementation. Preferred Skills:Experience with dbt for building data pipelines (experience with DataOps.live is even better). Familiarity with building data marts used by BI tools. Experience managing a Snowflake account. Competent data modeling skills, particularly in the Kimball method. Familiarity with AWS services. Degree in computer science or mathematics, or similar. Personality Traits:Ability to voice opinions constructively and collaborate effectively. Acceptance of decisions and commitment to move forward as a team. Strong work ethic and commitment to team success. BenefitsFlexible Time Off, Paid Holidays, 401(K), Equity, Health, Vision, Dental, Voluntary Life Insurance, Wellness Program and best of all working with awesome people - ask about that when you speak with us!HR PolicyWe’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. All Candidates must pass a drug screening and background check upon employment. Must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Computers and Electronics Manufacturing

title: Azure Data Engineer
job_description: DescriptionOur client is looking for someone who will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining their data infrastructure, ensuring its scalability, reliability, and performance. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both Azure and SQL technologies, with a deep understanding of data engineering best practices and a passion for creating robust and efficient data solutions.Key ResponsibilitiesData Architecture and Modeling: Design and implement scalable and efficient data models that meet the business requirements and support future growth. Work closely with data architects to ensure that the data architecture aligns with overall business goals and objectives. ETL Development: Develop, maintain, and optimize ETL processes using Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and other relevant tools. Ensure the seamless flow of data from source systems to data warehouses, data lakes, and other data repositories. Data Integration: Implement data integration solutions to consolidate data from various sources and provide a unified view for reporting and analytics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from different business units and systems. Azure Cloud Services: Utilize Azure services such as Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Data Lake Storage to build and manage data solutions. Implement and optimize data solutions in a cloud environment, ensuring high availability and security. SQL Development and Optimization: Write complex SQL queries and stored procedures to extract, transform, and load data efficiently. Optimize database performance through indexing, query optimization, and other tuning techniques. Data Quality and Governance: Implement and enforce data quality standards to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data. Collaborate with data governance teams to establish and maintain data quality policies and procedures. Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor data pipelines and systems to identify and address performance issues promptly. Collaborate with IT support teams to troubleshoot and resolve data-related incidents and outages. Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Document data engineering processes, data models, and ETL workflows for future reference. Share knowledge and best practices with team members to foster a collaborative and learning-oriented culture.RequirementsQualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience as a Data Engineer with a focus on both Azure and SQL technologies. Strong proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and ETL development. title: Software Engineer
job_description: DMBA (Deseret Mutual Benefit Administrators) is a non-profit organization that administers benefits for companies who are owned or affiliated with The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints. DMBA is looking for an entry-level software engineer to join our Platforms team. You will work with a team of other software engineers utilizing a robust development platform to create processes and systems to deliver tasks to the right people at the right time. If you're passionate about quality and take pride in your work, we'd like to meet you. Whether it be building a mobile app to assist participants worldwide in care management of medical conditions or creating a process to route health insurance claims to individuals and teams across many disciplines, there is no shortage of business problems to be solved. Job Duties: Utilize the Appian platform and other tools and technologies to develop solutions to business problems by following best software development practices. Design and implement solutions from the ground up, including database design, application architecture, user interface, configuration, and deployment. Integrate with various backend services, API's, and databases. Collaborate with team members and end users to gather and refine project specifications. Maintain and support existing processes. Participate in peer reviews of software design, coding, and testing. Deliver high quality products and ongoing alignment with business objectives. Identify, research, and resolve technical problems. Requirements: Object-oriented programming experience (e.g., Java, C#). Understanding of relational database design and querying. Ability and desire to quickly learn new technologies. Understanding of agile development practices. Effective written and verbal communication and presentation skills. Ability to interact and communicate with all levels of employees and clients. Self-motivated and great problem-solving skills. Detailed, organized, and able to think through and carry out the vision of an implementation. Pasion for quality and continuous improvement; excited to learn and contribute. Minimum typing of 50 WPM. Bachelor's degree (Information Systems, Computer Science, or other applicable degree). Experience with Appian, Pega, health insurance, or employee benefits is a plus. Experience and certifications in BPM low-code solutions is a plus. WHAT WE OFFER: Competitive pay Rich medical, vision and dental benefits with low premiums. One of the top health plans in Utah Rich retirement planning: including 401(k) company match, 8% EDRC Employer Discretionary Retirement Contribution (we just give you free money for retirement), life insurance, and full service Financial Planners onsite at no cost Generous paid leave plan that starts accruing your first day, your birthday off, additional sick leave and 12 paid holidays World class wellness program with health coaching, ability to earn 3 additional days off a year, fun activities and an onsite gym. Tuition reimbursement Career development through company sponsored programs and over 5000 on-demand online training courses. Hybrid work schedules available depending on position. title: Web Analytics Engineer
job_description: Web Analytics EngineerRole DescriptionCheck us out at Agilityads.com 🙌SummaryAgility is precision advertising. We enable companies to advertise to their audiences across millions of devices, apps, streaming TV, and Audio–to reach prospects wherever they are at precisely the right moment. We extend a company’s reach beyond paid search and social, with precision. We target medium enterprises with $50M to $2B in revenue. Building and executing strategies for our target customers is complex. Tracking performance even more so. This role requires a web analytics engineer with experience in marketing tracking and marketing analytics, working with media buying teams and marketing scientists to track and analyze buyer journey flows across digital properties.Current roles as a web analytics engineer, marketing tracking engineer, digital marketing analyst, or media buying analyst would be an excellent candidate for this role. Experience with tag management and tag manager platforms is a must. HistorySince its founding in 2018, Agility has made significant strides in the ad tech industry. Initially founded to serve the programmatic needs of small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), Agility identified a gap in the market in 2021 for an enterprise-grade advertising platform. This insight led to a strategic pivot, defining a new space in the ad tech industry: Precision Advertising. Our CultureCulture is something we obsess about and believe is foundational to all of our success. Everyone here is striving to do the best work of their lives but allowed to make mistakes and learn and grow at the same time. These three cultural pillars are our secret sauce.  We are people-first We work smartWe take extreme ownership of our work Every process, policy, and plan in our organization is viewed through this lens and we leverage these pillars to drive our business forward. The customer experience drives our strategy, roadmap, and expectations of ourselves. We recognize the rare opportunity for growth that is in front of us, and we are thrilled at the prospect of bringing on talented, smart, and driven team members to be a part of it! Value Proposition: What value does a Web Analytics Tracking Engineer bring to the team?The Web Analytics Engineer at Agility plays a crucial role in connecting our advertising strategies with actionable data insights to enhance our Customers' digital marketing success. This position requires a strong foundation in web analytics, including expertise in pixel management, tag placement, tag mapping, variable management, and advertising journey mapping, along with solid web development skills. The successful candidate will work closely with our customers in an Enterprise Marketing setting and a cross-functional team to ensure accurate data collection and analysis, vital for informed decision-making and strategy optimization.Experience, Qualities, & SkillsThe experience, qualities, and skills below will ensure your success in your role and in your responsibilities. This is our wish list– ideally, you would have all of these, but having most of them is probably more realistic:General QualitiesStrategic Vision & Planning: Develop and implement comprehensive web analytics strategies that align with customer objectives. Use deep insights gleaned from data analysis and tracking methodologies to propose best practices and ensure smooth implementation for the customer. Employ advanced analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions, ensuring measurable success and optimizing digital marketing efforts.Customer Relationship & Consultation: Serve as a technical and strategic guide for customers in navigating the complexities of web analytics. Engage in detailed discussions about tracking metrics, audience analysis, and the impact of analytics on marketing effectiveness, guiding customers toward informed decision-making and aiding the implementation of a tracking strategy. Collaboration & Leadership: Work with a cross-functional team to Integrate web analytics into the broader precision marketing strategy, ensuring a unified approach to achieving Customer goals. Promote a culture of continuous learning and development.Communication & Persuasion: Communicate complex tracking strategies to clients and team members. Gather tracking requirements from strategy consultants and customers through various channels, including email, Slack, and video calls. Principles & Ethics: Uphold the highest standards of integrity in data analysis and client interactions, focusing on delivering quality work that you’re proud of. Foster healthy professional relationships based on trust and mutual respect.Innovation & Growth: Identify new opportunities for leveraging web analytics to drive account growth and client satisfaction. Work closely with Precision Strategy Consultants and Product Owners to bring innovative solutions to the forefront, contributing to developing strategies that exceed client expectations. Support and initiate projects aligning with the company’s innovation and performance enhancement goals.Network & Advocacy: Cultivate a network of professionals and peers who recognize your expertise in web analytics and are ready to support and collaborate on initiatives you have led. Act as an ambassador for the company, sharing successes and best practices within your network to foster a positive image of the organization and encourage a culture of excellence and innovation.Role Specific Experience Minimum 4+ years of experience in web analytics engineering within the context of advertising agencies or digital marketing firms. Proven track record in implementing and managing analytics for various digital marketing campaigns, including but not limited to Display, CTV, Audio, and DooH.Proficiency in web analytics tools and technologies, including an in-depth understanding of analytics platforms such as Google Analytics or similar, and expertise in configuring and managing tags, UTM parameters, and pixels for comprehensive tracking across digital campaigns. Google Tag Manager certification is highly desirable or 3+ years GTM experience.Experience with data analysis and reporting in digital marketing contexts, demonstrating a strong capability in utilizing tools like Google Sheets or Excel to build and manage tracking implementations that generate actionable insights.Skilled in integrating and managing tracking technologies, such as UTM parameters, tags, and universal pixels, ensuring detailed and accurate data collection across digital properties for insightful analytics. Proficiency in third-party analytic platforms like GA or the like, leveraging these platforms for comprehensive tracking, analysis, and optimization of digital campaigns. This includes setup and configuration, understanding advanced tracking techniques, and utilizing the data to drive implementation strategies. Experience in using CRM tools for client relationship management, ensuring meticulous tracking and reporting of client interactions, activities, and outcomes through integrated analytics and data insights.Solid project management skills, demonstrated through the successful delivery of projects where Google Analytics played a central role in measuring and guiding the project’s success. Proficiency in project management tools like Hubspot, Monday, or Trello is essential.Tasks & ResponsibilitiesCustomer ManagementLead the technical setup and configuration meetings with customers, focusing on web analytics requirements and strategiesGuide discussions centered around web analytics insights, tracking methodologies, and data-driven decision-makingGain a thorough understanding of the customer’s internal structure and key stakeholders in marketing analytics and manage these relationships effectively.Coordinate with vendors, analytics partners, or other third-party platforms to integrate and optimize web analytics for the customerStrategy and ReportingAnalyze and segment the digital buyer journey to inform tracking strategies and improve analytics precision.Participate in discussions regarding the interpretation of data insights, contributing to the creative and strategic direction based on web analytics findingsOversee the monitoring and management of campaign analytics, ensuring accurate tracking of performance and advertising investmentsFacilitate the integration of web analytics insights into broader marketing strategies, working closely with customers and internal teams to optimize campaign outcomes through detailed data inputs. Internal Team ResponsibilitiesIdentify and prioritize key analytical initiatives, while efficiently distributing executional tasks among team members with a focus on leveraging specialized skillsRemain at the forefront of web analytics trends, tools, and best practices, sharing knowledge and recommendations with both customers and internal teamsRetention and UpsellTake ownership of the analytics component within customer portfolios, driving the strategic use of data to retain and expand customer engagementsCommit to achieving customer retention and revenue growth targets through strategic analytics enhancements and innovationsEmploy creativity and strategic timing in introducing new analytics-driven initiatives to customers aimed at continually enhancing their marketing effectiveness and ROICompensationSalary Range: Depending on experience, $80,000 - $150,000 Healthcare: We pay 100% of your and your dependents' healthcare, dental, and vision premiums. Benefits will be effective the 1st day of your first full month.Agility Lunches: Agility provides you with a weekly stipend of $50 to support your nutrition and keep you fueled at work!Paid Time Off: Uncapped Stock Options: Equity is subject to the rollout of Agility's stock option plan, currently projected for March 2024.Can’t wait to meet you and share all the details!  Daniel LemaireVP Marketing Science

title: Junior Security Engineer
job_description: This is a hybrid role, based in UT About the Company: AAPC is a leading provider of medical coding certification, dedicated to enhancing the accuracy, integrity, and quality of medical coding. As we continue to expand our digital infrastructure, we are seeking a proactive Junior Security Engineer to strengthen our security posture and protect our critical data and systems. Job Description: As a Junior Security Engineer, you will be an integral part of our IT and cybersecurity teams, tasked with implementing robust security measures across our infrastructure. You will monitor our systems and networks for security threats, implement security solutions, and respond to and mitigate security incidents. Responsibilities:Monitor and manage security solutions including FortiGate firewalls, FortiSIEM, and FortiEMS to ensure robust network and endpoint security.Oversee the security aspects of cloud services, particularly within AWS and Azure environments, integrating security controls with Azure AD.Conduct security audits and reviews and perform regular vulnerability assessments using tools like Darktrace.Implement and manage identity and access controls, integrating and maintaining Azure Active Directory (AD).Design and conduct internal phishing campaigns to assess employee vulnerability to phishing attacks and set up targeted training for employees who fail these tests to enhance their awareness and response strategies.Participate in internal security scans for PCI and SOC compliance, including the collection and organization of compliance evidence from teams on a quarterly basis.Assist in the development, enforcement, and audit of security policies and procedures that comply with SOC 2 and HIPAA regulations.Help maintain security documentation and ensure compliance with healthcare data protection standards.Educate and train staff on security protocols and best practices.Maintain up-to-date knowledge of security threats, solutions, and enhancements.Respond to and resolve security tickets logged by the system in a timely and effective manner. Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field.1-2 years of experience in an information security role, with hands-on experience in security products like FortiGate, FortiSIEM, FortiEMSFamiliarity with conducting phishing simulations and delivering security training programs.Understanding of security protocols, cybersecurity frameworks, and secure coding practices.Experience with cloud security aspects, particularly in O365, Azure and AWS.Strong analytical skills and ability to assess and manage risk.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment. Preferred Skills:Certifications such as CompTIA Security+, CEH is an added advantage.Understanding of AWS infrastructure and the basic workings of IIS and PHP.Knowledge of using FortiSIEM and Darktrace is an added advantage.Experience in the healthcare industry, with an understanding of SOC 2 and HIPAA compliance requirements.Experience in conducting PCI DSS compliance scans and related security assessments. Why Join Us? At AAPC you’ll join a team that values innovation, integrity, and a commitment to excellence. We offer a dynamic work environment with substantial opportunities for professional growth and development, allowing you to advance your career while contributing to critical advancements in healthcare technology. Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer Who we are: AAPC (www.aapc.com) is the nation’s largest and fastest-growing training, certification, and solutions association in healthcare, supporting more than 200,000 members. Attributes: DRIVEN | Self-starts and stays highly motivated to achieve ambitious goals. Shares contagious energy and enthusiasm liberally. Takes initiative without always being directed.Demonstrates confidence in decision-making and effectively balances autonomy and authority with accountability. HUMBLE | Learns, adapts, and improves relentlessly. Seeks feedback without insecurity and implements coaching. Recognizes others' contributions gratefully. Approaches work and relationships with an abundance mentality. Places the needs of others above self. TRANSPARENT | Integrity-centered, honest, truthful, and trustworthy in all aspects of work. Keeps commitments to external and internal parties. Holds self strictly accountable, valuing the trust placed in them by others. SUPPORTIVE | Empowers and uplifts others. Listens actively and responds with empathy and understanding. Prioritizes well-being and growth of team members and customers ahead of own interest. Faces challenges together, believing in collective strength and unity. INNOVATIVE | Entrepreneurial spirit with a scrappy mentality. Dreams big, sees opportunity, pursues full potential, and finds ways to accomplish the impossible. Rolls up sleeves and does real work. Works quickly, intelligently, and flexibly. What we Offer Compensation commensurate with experience Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental and vision insurance Health Savings Account Generous PTO and Holiday Pay 401(k) retirement plan Remote work-from-home option consideration AAPC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, disability, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above listed items.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Senior Data Engineer (5+ Years of Experience, On-site, Utah)
job_description: What you're about to read isn't your typical job description, and that's simply because we're not looking for any ordinary person to join our team. If you find yourself thinking, "Hey, this place sounds awesome," AND "I totally fit this bill," then we want you! Just know that we will absolutely hold off on hiring until we find the right person, BUT that this is absolutely one of the best places to work (we even have awards that back up our claims)JourneyTEAMJourneyTEAM is more than just a place to work; we are an organization that values creativity, innovative thinking, hard work, and fun. We offer an excellent opportunity to work alongside brilliant and motivated people. Founded in 1993, JourneyTEAM has grown from a small software implementation shop into an award-winning business-technology consulting firm. We are a Microsoft Advanced Specializations Partner that serves organizations of all sizes, including many of the world's best-known brands. We have expert-level consultants that help c ng, productivity, collaboration, accounting, business intelligence, and security. In short, we’re here to make a positive lasting impact on the world.Now that you know a little about us, here's a little about the position!Position OverviewOur Business Intelligence and Analytics team started in October of 2018 and is quickly growing. We largely attribute that growth to the fact that customers simply love working with us. We attribute their love of working with us to the fact that we positively impact their lives and organizations.This position is to join our team as a Sr. Data Engineer and spend time ingesting, transforming, manipulating, and otherwise engineering lots of data. For example, some of our clients have tables that grow by more than 500 million rows a day (not too shabby for the world of big data).Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesIf these things don't sound like fun, you're just not going to like working on this team. And if it isn't already clear, we REALLY want you to like working on our teamLead the builds of Data Warehouses/Lakehouses. From front to back, top to bottom, your daily job will include building data warehouses/lakehouses, migrating data, and developing data models for many different companies (and teaching others to do so as you go). Work with clients to assess their current organizational situation. Then, create project plans to address concerns while offering the correct solutions to their specific scenarios. We recognize that not all solutions will fit each customer the same, and we adjust our approach based on the customer's particular needs. Build rapport with customers and work to develop long-term relationships through delivering projects on time, under budget, and being genuinely caring about the work you do. We fully understand that without our customers, we don't have jobs; building and maintaining good relationships with our customers is not only good for business, but it's also good business. Create pipelines, dataflows, ETL jobs, data transformations, and other data-related objects to expand the paradigm in which a client is operating. We believe in being the catalyst in the transformation an organization will go through when they successfully use their data to grow and drive their business. This one is big. If you don't love working with data, you won't love this job. Actively participating in the growth of our team at JourneyTEAM. We believe having a growth mindset isn't just a business term; it's a way of life. (If you haven't read Mindset by Carol Dweck, you should. It's a great book) (and if you don't like reading books, you should. Reading books makes you a better person (Winston Churchill said so.)).Willingly admitting faults and striving to be a better person, team member, and contributing member of society. We know that "Leadership is not about titles or the corner office. It's about the willingness to step up, put yourself out there, and lean into courage." (Dare to Lead, by Brené Brown. Read this one too. You'll like it.).Required Qualifications5+ years of experience of ETL, data warehouse, and data modeling experience Be an extremely personable leader. This person will be leading projects and will be the face of JourneyTEAM for our customers. They’ll be responsible to clearly communicate expectations, roadblocks, and hurdles with clients and to help teach and train junior resources. Have an innate, insatiable appetite for learning. Consulting is a breading ground for growth and learning. If you don’t love change and learning new things, you won’t like this role.Be a world-class team member who is "humble, hungry, and smart" (look it up if you don't recognize the reference). Working with others is not only something you can do but something you actually enjoy doing. Be able to see and find opportunities in data and then clearly express those opportunities visually and verbally (both for the technically savvy and those less so).Be very fun to work with. We have a very tight-knit team and we aim to keep it so! Able to write, understand, explain, and teach the most complex SQL & Python (though ideally you’re more interested in solving complicated soluting using the most simple code)! Successful track record of architecting data solutions per business requirements, including integration with other platforms and services Expert in designing and building data warehouse dimensional models.Able to write code in SQL, Python, and one other languageAdvanced skills with 5 or more of the following:SQL Server Integration ServicesSQL Server/Azure SQL ServerAzure Data FactoryAzure DatabricksApache Spark, PySpark, SparkSQL Azure Synapse AnalyticsMicrosoft FabricAzure Data LakeEmbrace and live the JourneyTEAM ValuesA Caring MindsetExceptional PerformanceBeing OneTeamMaking & Keeping CommitmentsTaking OwnershipEffective CommunicationA Growth MindsetPreferred Qualifications Experience with Power BIA clear understanding of statistics and how they impact the proper representation of data for a customer.Master's degree in math, engineering, statistics, data analytics, economics, or another related or quantitative field. Rock Star QualificationsBe a Microsoft MVP for 1 or more Azure Data toolsPh.D. in engineering, statistics, data analytics, economics, or another related/quantitative field. Compensation$95,000 - $157,000 DOE + performance-based bonus structureBenefitsJourneyTEAM offers a wide range of excellent benefits including healthcare and dental options, as well as a 401k with an approximate 4% employer match with funds that vest immediately. We enjoy flexible time off and our employees average 3.5 to 4 weeks off a year. We also provide a monthly phone stipend of $25 as well as a gym membership monthly reimbursement of up to $200. We enjoy a culture of collaboration and creative responsibility to solve problems with autonomy.JourneyTEAM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This position is not open to C2C, H1B's or third-party agencies.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Infrastructure
job_description: Employee Applicant Privacy NoticeWho we are:Shape a brighter financial future with us.Together with our members, we’re changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance.We’re a next-generation financial services company and national bank using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we’re at the forefront. We’re proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people’s lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world.The Role:We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our Platform Application Services team to create high-quality software that simplifies complex tasks and enhances developer productivity. You will have the opportunity to directly impact the direction and architecture of our cloud platforms such as Kafka and Temporal that are used across all of SoFi engineering. If you are a seasoned Software Engineer with a passion for building software and a strong background in cloud technologies, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.What You’ll Do:Responsible for designing, developing and maintaining software that enables developers to interact with our Infrastructure and services. Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand the requirements and design software that is intuitive, efficient, scalable and reliable.Provide technical leadership for the platform application services to design and implement strategies for optimizing cloud costs, resource utilization, and overall performance.Lead the development of software solutions to enable engineers to seamlessly use infrastructure services.Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement to enhance developer productivity. Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate’s experience, skills, and location.To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page!SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.The Company hires the best qualified candidate for the job, without regard to protected characteristics.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.New York applicants: Notice of Employee RightsSoFi is committed to embracing diversity. As part of this commitment, SoFi offers reasonable accommodations to candidates with physical or mental disabilities. If you need accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email accommodations@sofi.com.Due to insurance coverage issues, we are unable to accommodate remote work from Hawaii or Alaska at this time.Internal EmployeesIf you are a current employee, do not apply here - please navigate to our Internal Job Board in Greenhouse to apply to our open roles.

title: Software Engineer
job_description: OverviewPosition Summary:As an integral member of the Control Systems team, the Software Engineer will play a critical role in the design and implementation of several key tools to enable effective control of the accelerator system used for radioisotope production. A successful candidate will work closely with cross functional teams such as IT and Operations to deliver key integrations for a first-of-its-kind production system. The ideal candidate would have a background in building applications across the engineering life cycle, from gathering requirements to testing and commissioning. A background in physics and an interest in UI and data visualization is preferred.ResponsibilitiesWhat You'll Do:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain applications for accelerators and isotope production systems. Perform front-end, back-end and data storage tasks as needed. Interface with engineering managers and technical experts from concept to commissioning. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and support deployment. Provide up-to-date, accurate information to colleagues and management. QualificationsMinimum Requirements:B.S Degree in Computer Science, Physics, Electrical/Computer Engineering, or related field. Minimum of three (3) years of experience with software development using one or more high level programming languages (JavaScript/Python)Experience with modern front-end web development technologiesUnderstanding of basic database structures and queries. Familiarity with Source Control / Code branch Management and CI/CD unit testing. Preferred Requirements:Experience with additional high level programming languages (C++/Java)Experience with UX design and data visualizationDeveloped applications using APIs and RESTful services with any ERP databasePhysical Requirements:Must be comfortable working in a facility that produces radiation. Work to be conducted in both an office environment and the production facility. Must be able to sit for long periods of time. Frequent use of computer with repetitive use of keyboard, mouse and manual dexterity<10% TravelAbout Nusano:No patient should be denied the cancer care they need simply because some options are in short supply or unavailable. Yet, all too often, this is what happens.Nusano is a medical technology company that creates radioisotopes used to target and eliminate cancer cells with precision. Health care has used radioisotopes to diagnose and treat cancer and other diseases for decades. But, if supply does not keep up with demand, patients will lose out on the benefits of these lifesaving, proven tools.Nusano’s patented technologies and methods are poised to transform radioisotope production and usher in an exciting new era in cancer care. Our state-of-the-art facility in West Valley City, Utah will produce radioisotopes quickly, efficiently, and affordably. This will make desperately needed resources available to hospitals and cancer clinics around the world and offer those with life-threatening diseases hope for a healthier tomorrow. Posted Salary Range USD $100,000.00 - USD $120,000.00 /Yr.BenefitsComprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and their eligible dependentsStock Options401(K) Retirement PlanCompany-paid life insurance & AD&D coverageCompany-paid short-term disability coverageHealthcare Flexible Spending Account (FSA)Dependent Care Reimbursement Account (DCRA)Voluntary Life InsuranceEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Vacation, Sick Time, and Holidays

title: Senior Software Engineer, Kubernetes P-046
job_description: Job SummaryOur software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with their finances. Our products need to handle data at a massive scale. You’ll work alongside the best and the brightest engineering talent in the industry. We have opportunities in a wide range of areas including development, design, search, platform, test, quality, big data, front end and back end. As a core participant of your team, you’ll estimate engineering efforts, design your changes, implement and test your changes, push to live, and triage production issues. You need to be dynamic, collaborative, and curious as we build new experiences, improve existing products, and develop distributed systems powering the world to be financially strongWe need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.Job DutiesWrite product or system development code.Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).Enforce clean code and excellent coding practices by conducting thoughtful code reviews.Help us build and maintain a world-class technology system so we can achieve our mission of making the world financially strong.Collaborate closely with Product Managers to meet and exceed customer needs in the simplest possible ways.Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.Actively participate in system architecture discussions and technical design reviews to ensure scalability, reliability, and security.Lead by example, and elevate the design, implementation, quality, and strong engineering practices across the team.Drive projects and initiatives to implement high quality systems and productsCoach and support engineers on the team, with a strong focus on feedback and growth. Basic RequirementsBachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.8+ years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages with data structures or algorithms, preferred.5+ years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 3 years of experience with software design and architecture, preferred.Experience working with KubernetesAdvanced Requirements (preferred But Not Required)Master’s Degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.

title: Staff Data Engineer
job_description: Strider is revolutionizing the way companies, universities, research institutions, and government agencies protect their innovation and compete in a new era of global strategic competition. Our trailblazing technology and intelligence solutions enable clients to proactively identify, manage, and respond to foreign government directed IP theft and supply chain vulnerabilities. The Data Engineering team is responsible for building structured data assets from these raw documents to build new products and enhance existing ones.If you’re ready to be part of an elite team tackling some of the most pressing security and technology challenges, let’s talk.Responsibilities For This RoleDevelop large scale data processing pipelines Create data assets from unstructured dataBuild and support internal and external facing APIsAuthor design documentsMentor teammatesDrive software engineering best practicesParticipate in code reviewsCollaborate with a talented cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists and subject-matter expertsYou are a good fit for this role if you:Have 8+ years of software engineering experiencePrevious experience working in a data heavy roleUnderstand how to use cloud infrastructure effectivelyAre a natural problem solver with an affinity for dataAre opinionated about how software is builtAre proficient at breaking down large, sometimes ambiguous, problems into well-defined tasksValue shipping code early and oftenHave a well-honed mental model for how software systems execute and interactTechnologies We UsePythonElasticsearchMemgraphFlyteAWS (EC2, S3, SQS, DynamoDB, Lambda, EKS)BenefitsCompetitive CompensationCompany Equity OptionsFlexible PTOWellness ReimbursementUS Holidays (Office Closed)Paid Parental LeaveComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance401(k) PlanStrider provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. title: Sr Data Science Engineer
job_description: Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!The OpportunityAre you driven to use your expertise in data science engineering to drive the next stage of growth at Adobe? The Customer Analytics & GTM team is focused on using the power of data to deliver optimized experiences through personalization. This role will drive data engineering for large-scale data science initiatives across a wide variety of strategic projects.As a member of the Data Science Engineering team, you will have significant responsibility to help build large scale cloud-based data and analytics platform with enterprise-wide consumers. This role is inherently multi-functional, and the ideal candidate will work across teams. The position requires ability to own things, come up with innovative solutions, try new tools, technologies, and entrepreneurial personality.Come join us for a truly exciting career, best benefits and outstanding work life balance.What You Will DoBuild fault tolerant, scalable, quality data pipelines using multiple cloud- based tools. Deliver End to End Data Pipelines to run Machine Learning Models in a production platform. Innovative solutions to help broader organization take significant actions fast and efficiently. Chip in to data engineering and data science frameworks, tools, and processes. Implement outstanding data operations and implement standard methodologies to use resources in an optimum way. Architect data ingestion, data transformation, data consumption, data governance frameworks. Help build production grade ML models and integration with operational systems. This is a high visibility role for a team which is on a critical mission to stop software privacy. A lot of collaboration with global multi-functional operations teams is required to onboard the customers to use genuine software. Work in a collaborative environment and contribute to the team as well as organization’s success. What You Will NeedBachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent. Master’s degree is preferred. 8+ years of proven track record as a data engineer. 5+ years validated ability in distributed data technologies e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Spark etc. 3+ years of experience with Cloud based technologies – Databricks, S3, Azure Blob Storage, Notebooks, AWS EMR, Athena, Glue etc. Familiarity and usage of different file formats in batch/streaming processing i.e., Delta/Parquet/ORC etc. 2+ years’ experience with streaming data ingestion and transformation using Kafka, Kinesis etc. Outstanding SQL experience. Ability to write optimized SQLs across platforms. Hands-on experience in Python/PySpark/Scala and ability to manipulate data using Pandas, NumPy, Koalas etc. and using APIs to transfer data. Experience working as an architect to design large scale distributed data platforms. Experience with CI/CD tools i.e., GitHub, Jenkins etc. Working experience with Open- source orchestration tools i.e., Apache Air Flow/ Azkaban etc. Teammate with excellent communication/teamwork skills when it comes to closely working with data scientists and machine learning engineers daily. Hands-on work experience with Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana) and Graph Databases (neo4j, Neptune etc.) is highly desired. Work experience with ML algorithms & frameworks i.e., Keras, Tensor Flow, PyTorch, XGBoost, Linear Regression, Classification, Random Forest, Clustering, mlFlow etc. Nice to haveShowcase your work if you are an open - source contributor. Passion to contribute to Open-source community is highly valued. Experience with Data Governance tools e.g., Collibra and Collaboration tools e.g., JIRA/ Confluence etc. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $127,300 -- $229,300 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

title: Principal Data Engineer (10+ years experience, On-site, Utah)
job_description: What you're about to read isn't your typical job description, and that's simply because we're not looking for any ordinary person to join our team. If you find yourself thinking, "Hey, this place sounds awesome," AND "I totally fit this bill," then we want you! Just know that we will absolutely hold off on hiring until we find the right person, BUT that this is absolutely one of the best places to work (we even have awards that back up our claims)JourneyTEAMJourneyTEAM is more than just a place to work; we are an organization that values creativity, innovative thinking, hard work, and fun. We offer an excellent opportunity to work alongside brilliant and motivated people. Founded in 1993, JourneyTEAM has grown from a small software implementation shop into an award-winning business-technology consulting firm. We are a Microsoft Advanced Specializations Partner that serves organizations of all sizes, including many of the world's best-known brands. We have expert-level consultants that help companies dive deep into the dynamics of their organization and solve complex issues that will improve a company's sales, marketing, productivity, collaboration, accounting, business intelligence, and security. In short, we’re here to make a positive lasting impact on the world.Now that you know a little about us, here's a little about the position!Position OverviewOur Business Intelligence and Analytics team started in October of 2018 and is quickly growing. We largely attribute that growth to the fact that customers simply love working with us. We attribute their love of working with us to the fact that we positively impact their lives and organizations.This position is to join our team as a Principal Data Engineer and spend time ingesting, transforming, manipulating, and otherwise engineering lots of data. For example, some of our clients have tables that grow by more than 500 million rows a day (not too shabby for the world of big data).Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesIf these things don't sound like fun, you're just not going to like working on this team. And if it isn't already clear, we REALLY want you to like working on our teamLead the builds of Data Warehouses/Lakehouses. From front to back, top to bottom, your daily job will include building data warehouses/lakehouses, migrating data, and developing data models for many different companies (and teaching others to do so as you go). Work with clients to assess their current organizational situation. Then, create project plans to address concerns while offering the correct solutions to their specific scenarios. We recognize that not all solutions will fit each customer the same, and we adjust our approach based on the customer's particular needs. Build rapport with customers and work to develop long-term relationships through delivering projects on time, under budget, and being genuinely caring about the work you do. We fully understand that without our customers, we don't have jobs; building and maintaining good relationships with our customers is not only good for business, but it's also good business. Create pipelines, dataflows, ETL jobs, data transformations, and other data-related objects to expand the paradigm in which a client is operating. We believe in being the catalyst in the transformation an organization will go through when they successfully use their data to grow and drive their business. This one is big. If you don't love working with data, you won't love this job. Actively participating in the growth of our team at JourneyTEAM. We believe having a growth mindset isn't just a business term; it's a way of life. (If you haven't read Mindset by Carol Dweck, you should. It's a great book) (and if you don't like reading books, you should. Reading books makes you a better person (Winston Churchill said so.)).Willingly admitting faults and striving to be a better person, team member, and contributing member of society. We know that "Leadership is not about titles or the corner office. It's about the willingness to step up, put yourself out there, and lean into courage." (Dare to Lead, by Brené Brown. Read this one too. You'll like it.).Required Qualifications10+ years of experience of ETL, data warehouse, and data modeling experience Be an extremely personable leader. This person will be leading projects and will be the face of JourneyTEAM for our customers. They’ll be responsible to clearly communicate expectations, roadblocks, and hurdles with clients and to help teach and train junior resources. Have an innate, insatiable appetite for learning. Consulting is a breading ground for growth and learning. If you don’t love change and learning new things, you won’t like this role.Be a world-class team member who is "humble, hungry, and smart" (look it up if you don't recognize the reference). Working with others is not only something you can do but something you actually enjoy doing. Be able to see and find opportunities in data and then clearly express those opportunities visually and verbally (both for the technically savvy and those less so).Be very fun to work with. We have a very tight-knit team and we aim to keep it so! Able to write, understand, explain, and teach the most complex SQL & Python (though ideally you’re more interested in solving complicated soluting using the most simple code)! Successful track record of architecting data solutions per business requirements, including integration with other platforms and services Expert in designing and building data warehouse dimensional models.Able to write code in SQL, Python, and one other languageAdvanced skills with 5 or more of the following:SQL Server Integration ServicesSQL Server/Azure SQL ServerAzure Data FactoryAzure DatabricksApache Spark, PySpark, SparkSQL Azure Synapse AnalyticsMicrosoft FabricAzure Data LakeEmbrace and live the JourneyTEAM ValuesA Caring MindsetExceptional PerformanceBeing OneTeamMaking & Keeping CommitmentsTaking OwnershipEffective CommunicationA Growth MindsetPreferred Qualifications Experience with Power BIA clear understanding of statistics and how they impact the proper representation of data for a customer.Master's degree in math, engineering, statistics, data analytics, economics, or another related or quantitative field. Rock Star QualificationsBe a Microsoft MVP for 1 or more Azure Data toolsPh.D. in engineering, statistics, data analytics, economics, or another related/quantitative field. Compensation$135,000 - $187,000 DOE + performance-based bonus structureBenefitsJourneyTEAM offers a wide range of excellent benefits including healthcare and dental options, as well as a 401k with an approximate 4% employer match with funds that vest immediately. We enjoy flexible time off and our employees average 3.5 to 4 weeks off a year. We also provide a monthly phone stipend of $25 as well as a gym membership monthly reimbursement of up to $200. We enjoy a culture of collaboration and creative responsibility to solve problems with autonomy.JourneyTEAM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This position is not open to C2C, H1B's or third-party agencies.

title: Software Engineer - 131185
job_description: Staff and AdministrativeWhy  work at BYU?As the flagship higher education institution of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, Brigham Young University (BYU) strives to be among the exceptional universities in the world. At BYU, we are devoted to our faith and to our students. We take an active role in the university's mission : "To assist individuals in their quest for perfection and eternal life ."Our unique mission, deeply rooted in the Gospel of Jesus Christ, provides countless ways to serve and make an impact. This, along with our remarkable culture of belonging, weekly devotionals, and endless opportunities for learning and growth - all situated within a beautiful and historic campus - make it hard to imagine a more inspiring place to work.Software EngineerAbout UsJoin the dynamic and collaborative Software Engineering team at the BYU Library. As a Software Engineer you will play a crucial role in providing access to a wealth of knowledge and resources for all BYU students, faculty, and staff.What you'll do in this position:  Collaborate and Innovate: Work closely with both full-time Software Engineers and student developers in an agile environment. Together, we build and maintain web services and applications that support all areas of the library.  Mentorship and Supervision: As a Software Engineer, you'll have the opportunity to mentor and supervise BYU student developers. Guide them as they contribute to new and existing applications, fostering their growth and development.  Professional Growth: At BYU, we value continuous learning. Attend conferences, participate in trainings, and stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and library trends.  Technologies: Python Django, Java Spring Boot (legacy), Angular, PostgreSQL, Apache Solr, Apache Kafka, GitLab, Docker, Kubernetes What qualifies you for this role:Required A firm commitment to the mission of BYU  Bachelor's degree in IT related field or equivalent combination of education and experience (4 years).  Proficiency in Python, Java or other object-oriented programming language  Proficiency with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS  Experience with SQL database structures, queries, and design  Experience with and understanding of web services, particularly REST  Familiarity with Linux/Unix environments and scripting  Familiarity with version control systems and practices (Git)  Ability to write clean, secure, well-documented code  Ability to write automated tests  Ability to dive into existing applications to troubleshoot and fix problems  Excellent communication skills, particularly the ability to communicate technical issues clearly to non-technical audiences  Ability to collaborate and coordinate projects with other developers  Ability to work independently and know when to seek guidance Preferred Proficiency in SQL database structures, queries, and design  Experience with Python Django or Java Spring Boot  Experience with Angular or other JavaScript framework  Experience working in an agile environment What we offer in return:In addition to our competitive pay structure, this position comes with fantastic benefits , including: 401k. BYU automatically contributes 8% at no cost to you. Additionally, if you contribute 5%, BYU adds an additional 4% ( Rehires may qualify for different retirement plans)  Excellent work-life balance: 13 paid holidays + 22 days paid vacation + 12 sick days, accrued annually  Employee assistance program, available to the employee and all members of their household  Tuition benefits for employees and eligible family members  Access to athletic facilities  Excellent medical/dental benefits  Short/long term disability benefits  Paid parental and maternity leave  Wellness program  Free on-campus parking  Free UTA passes for employee, spouse, and qualified dependents  Discounts at the BYU Store and for many events at BYU United by our common primary identity as children of God, BYU values equal opportunity. We also value and embrace the variety of individual characteristics, life experiences and circumstances, perspectives, talents, and gifts of each member of the BYU community and the richness and strength they bring in helping create and support an environment of covenant belonging centered in Jesus Christ. Candidates with experience in and commitment to mentoring students from a variety of backgrounds are encouraged to apply.Employee Class: AdministrativeWork Location: Provo CampusDesired Start Date: As soon as possibleJob Close Date: 05/05/2024Pay Level: 53/54TApproximate Starting Salary: $69,000 - $107,500, depending on qualificationsDocuments Required at time of Application:Required: Cover Letter, ResumeOptional: Letter of RecommendationMembers of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints must hold and be worthy to hold a current temple recommend.Brigham Young University is an equal opportunity employer, including disability and protected veteran status.Brigham Young University (BYU) is widely recognized not just for its world-class education, but for its deep commitment to inspired religious values. Gathered together in a Christ-centered atmosphere, BYU employees are a vital part of a community of belonging, where we value the experiences, perspectives, and talents of each individual. If you share in our devotion to faith and to excellence, we have a place for you here at BYU!

title: Software Engineer II, III, Sr.
job_description: Job DescriptionThe senior software engineer provides advanced technical expertise and guidance in the architecture, design, programming, testing, documentation and implementation of complex computer applications and systems. Evaluates software packages, provides recommendations to management and business clients, and identifies best technology solutions. Identifies future needs for key technologies and techniques and develops plans for adoption. This is considered a leadership position within the application development organization.About UsBHE Pipeline Group consists of Berkshire Hathaway Energy’s interstate natural gas pipeline companies, BHE GT&S, Kern River Gas Transmission Company and Northern Natural Gas Company. Combined, BHE Pipeline Group operates approximately 21,200 miles of pipeline with a design capacity of approximately 21.1 billion cubic feet of natural gas per day, owns assets in 27 states and transported approximately 15% of the total natural gas consumed in the U.S. during 2022. BHE Pipeline Group also operates 22 natural gas storage facilities with a total working gas capacity of 515.6 billion cubic feet and a liquefied natural gas export, import and storage facility.OrganizationAt Kern River Gas Transmission Company, we celebrate diversity, equity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or religious creed, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status (except as required by law), gender (including gender identity and expression), sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, familial or parental status, marital status or any other category protected by applicable local, state or U.S. federal law.

This is a unique opportunity for a seasoned professional to make a significant impact on groundbreaking projects that will shape the future of our flagship Dentrix Ascend product.What You Will DoLead the design and development of scalable, reliable, and high-performance identity and access management solutions for Dentrix Ascend Craft code that reflects an expert understanding of object-oriented design, refactoring, clean code, clean architecture, and solid engineering principles to drive innovationFollow the Test-Driven Development (TDD) paradigmProvide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth Conduct code reviews, identify areas for improvement, and enforce best practices to ensure code quality and maintainability Solve complex problems using knowledge, passion, and curiosity Partner with our DevOps team to build and support CI/CD pipelines Technologies We UseJava Spring BootGroovy, GrailsSQL (MS SQL Server, Postgres) React, Vue, BackboneContainerization (Docker) Micro-Service Architecture REST API DevelopmentTravel/Physical DemandsTravel typically less than 10%.
